runs.comm: good Tait seems to have turned. A yorker at middle and off first up. Some swing away too. 144ks only. Dug out by Sharma
another outswinging yorker, dug out to extra cover. Only 141ks. Concentrating on release more than pace?
misses the length, offers a half-volley, punched to the left of extra cover for four. Sharma in form
and there is the bad Tait. Wide down the leg side
on a length, 144ks, hit back into the stumps at the non-striker's end
nudges 150ks, but bowls a leg-side wide at 149ks
nicely bowled and nicely played. This is short of a length, rising towards the chest, and Sharms rises with the bounce to run it down to third man for one
wide length ball, Dhawan drills this straight to mid-off, and Sharma turns down the single off the misfield. There was perhaps a single available there
length ball, middle and leg, worked to deep square leg for one
lovely shot. Short of a length, widish, and he goes back to seer it past point to the short off-side boundary
well done by Head at point. Dhawan square-drives from down the wicket, and Head fields it well despite the awkward bounce
short of a length, outside off, sort of shanks the attempted back-foot drive
what a shot. Some premeditation but a graceful shot. Makes room early, gets under a shortish ball and chips it over cover for four
goes for the short leg-side boundary this time, but can't beat deep square leg to his right. Kept down to two
short of a length, into the hip, cramping him up, tucked away off the hip for a two. Nicely played
big wide down the leg side. Bancroft does really well with a one-handed save to his left
length ball, into the pads, flicked away for three into the bigger side of the ground
another wide down the leg side. Looks to cramp him up with a short ball, but goes too far down leg
wide length ball, driven over mid-off for four. Tait is getting destroyed
this is carnage. Gentle length ball on the pads, whipped away for a six
Tait is clueless. He has bowled to the left and he has bowled to the right, and he has conceded runs all over. Short and wide here, and Dhawan loves the square cut over point
slower ball, full, driven past cover now. Won't go all the way
oh Dhawan is peppering the short boundaries. Short of a length, enough width on it for Dhawan to run it past point for four

golden arm if ever there was one. Dhawan steps out of the crease, gets a shortish delivery, looks to repeat the dose, but the ball bounces a touch more than expected and takes the edge. Watson is doing it all by himself
does he need sighters anymore? He has punched this right off the middle of the bat first up. What timing. Flies towards mid-on
short of a length, worked to leg for one
lovely yorker, middle and off, 137ks, dug out back to Watson
short ball, outside off, pulled to the left of deep midwicket for a couple
oh boy what is Kohli on? He has just come in and is middling everything. Down the wicket to drive this on the up, and between mid-off and extra cover
that is unlucky. Short slower offcutter, but it turns too much from outside off to be called a wide down leg
and nearly a run-out. Sharma-Kohli misunderstanding goes on. Kohli has dabbed this to short third, but he doesn't instinctively trust his partner's call. He runs late and has to dive to make it in

this has clearly flicked Sharma's leg down the leg side, but both the Indian batsmen behaving ridiculously. Sharma asks why this is not called a wide, and Kohli asks him if he is kidding him. Clear sound and clear deflection on the replay. Must be wearing great protection if Sharma didn't feel this
this is a clear big wide down the leg side
chipped down to straight of long-on for two
nearly yorker, dug back into the stumps at the non-striker's end
lovely shot. Half-volley on off, and he has send this over mid-off with minimum of fuss
short of a length, offcutter, beats Kohli's drive
yorker, middle and leg, punched to midwicket
Kohli has found the gap superbly as he flicks this full ball between mid-on and midwicket
Kohli picks the slower ball early, dances down the track and wallops the length ball over long-on for six. Doesn't even look up to see where it has gone
short, into the body, with the short leg-side boundary, paddled away past short fine leg for two
Kohli is down the wicket again, and drives this over point for two more. India well on course here
full, middle and leg, driven to long-off for one
shorter, flatter, punched wide of long-off, and they come back for an easy second
full, middle and leg, no room, flicked to short midwicket
pushes forward and then rocks back to punch it between long-off and deep cover. Boland is looking for a relay throw as he dives and fields but Marsh has over-run him so that allows them a third
driven to long-off for one
full, middle and leg, no room, flicked to short midwicket again
short of a length, wide, Sharma loves it as he rocks back to late-cut it for four. Makes it look ridiculously easy
short of a length, angling in, punched to long-on for one
short of a length, lovely batting, as he places this wide of long-on with soft hands. Comes back for the second easily
slower ball, middle and leg, pushed to long-on for one
full and outside off, punched down to long-off for one
low full toss, down the wicket, drives it to long-on for a single
swept away from middle and leg for a single to long leg
full, middle and off, driven between long-off and deep cover for two
flatter non-turning delivery, beats the inside edge and hits the pad
down the wicket to drive it straight to the man who has just come to cover
slow in the air, cramping him up, chipped to long-on for one
finally a good over for Australia. He refuses to give Kohli any room and the full ball is pushed to long-on. Just the five runs off that over
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
good pace there, skids along at 145ks, beats the inside edge, hits the pad a touch high
Tait is still as quick, and Sharma is looking a little tired. This is a length ball, but he is late into it, and mis-hits this just short of long-on
grunt from Tait as he lets this wide full ball in, and Kohli squeezes it out beautifully past point for two
quick, on a length, 147ks, tucked away off the pads for one
hits him high on the bat with a length ball and it goes to long-on for a single
low full toss, driven to deep cover for one
low full toss, driven to long-off
flat, outside off, out of Sharma's reach as he charges at him. Can't take the single to extra cover
and Sharma gets the full toss to break the pressure. Down the wicket and whacks this high full toss over the short leg-side boundary. As you were...
another full toss, but this is driven to deep cover for one
down the wicket, takes this on the full, takes a single to long-on
yorker as Kohli gives him the charge. Just the single to long-off
picks the slower offcutter and drags this into the big leg-side boundary with a slog. Placed perfectly in front of deep midwicket for four
low full toss, driven nicely to deep cover for another fifty in Australia. Generous applause for him
low full toss, punched wide of deep cover for a couple
slower short ball, dabbed to short third man for one
Sharma looks to make room and go to cover, but gets an inside edge into the leg side for a single
slow legbreak, Sharma punches it to long-off for one
goes wide on the crease, cramps him up, chipped to long-on for one

Boyce gets the wicket after building the pressure going at a strike rate of 100. Sharma plays a tired chip shot off the toes, and finds midwicket with it. Sharma has done his job, though. Asking rate less than what it was when they started the chase
down the wicket to punch this straight to extra cover

part-time wicketkeeper has missed a stumping. This is a big wicket gone a-begging. Nice legbreak, dipping on Raina, who has walked past it, but Bancroft is done in by the extra bounce. Not a good night for the wicketkeepers. And Yuvraj goes back into the dugout
and Raina makes them pay immediately. This is like salt into the wounds. He has slog-swept this away for a six
lovely yorker to cramp him up
wide length ball driven to deep cover for one
he tries the bouncer but this is not good enough. This is only hip high, and Raina has tucked this fine of fine leg for an easy four

this is better from Tait, but Raina has played this superbly. Rising towards the chest, Raina fends with almost no bottom hand, and ends up placing this just outside the 30-yard circle on the leg side. Comes back for an easy second
a touch too short, and Kohli spots it early and rocks back pull it in front of deep midwicket for four. Pressure on the bowler already
down the wicket, gets too close to it, and punches it to extra cover
nicely bowled, gets it to dip on his toes, but Kohli has managed to place it wide of long-on for two
that's third straight fifty for Kohli. In the form of his life. Down the wicket to drive this legbreak wide of long-off for two. Acknowledges the crowd all around the dial

Kohli is bowled in a roundabout way. Boyce has kept Australia in the contest. This has been a good contest between him and Kohli. Kohli has been charging at Boyce who has still been managing to york him with some dip on his deliveries. This one takes the cue end, hits the pad, ricochets into the stumps
legbreak, outside off, defended by Yuvraj. What an excellent spell from Boyce
low full toss, on the pads, played with soft hands towards long-on. Comes back for the second
slower ball, nearly a yorker, Raina gets an outside edge, but this time Bancroft is equal to it and dives to his left to save runs here
that's an error by Tye, and Raina makes him pay for it. Short of a length, pitched well outside leg, and all he has to do is deflect it fine. He does so
beautiful batting. Slower ball, short of a length, and he opens the face in front of off to find the gap between point and short third man. Comes back for two
down the wicket, takes this on the full, pushed to deep midwicket for one
bouncer, tennis-ball bounce, Yuvraj fends at it while looking away from the ball. I hear something as it passes the bat. Bancroft does too, but he is the only one appealing
another boundary early in the over. Watson looks for the slower short ball, and Raina has paddled this from rib high for a four
low full toss, soft hands from Raina, towards long-on, but Yuvraj can't come back for the second
short of a length, outside off, dabbed away to point for his first run on the tour
yorker, outside off, bounces over the attempted steer, and draws half a shout from Watson for a catch at the wicket. The noise is the bat hitting the ground
slower bouncer, Raina doesn't play at it, and it is called wide for height. Fairly so. This is well high
low full toss, slugged away to deep midwicket for one

Yuvraj premeditates. Moves across the stumps to try to pull to the short leg-side boundary. Misses this skiddy shortish ball. Is hit on the pad. Eventually a good over for Australia. Goes for fewer than the asking rate
yorker, accurate, perfect. The dot ball takes the asking rate to two a ball
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for two. Past square leg it goes
full toss, quick full toss, thigh high, Raina looks to open the face and is beaten by the pace
Raina innovates by moving across the stumps to play a pick-up on this low full toss. Gets a couple to deep square leg

Rain gets lucky now. And how bad is Bancroft feeling about that missed stumping? Raina is done in completely by the slower ball, and Raina edges while looking for the drive over cover. Goes tantalisingly past the flying wicketkeeper, Bancroft

Raina puts India ahead with this bit of innovation. Moves across early, gets a length ball on the pads, and deflects it fine of short fine leg for four. Kohli likes it, and jumps out of his seat in the dugout. Under two a ball now. Focus on to Yuvraj

Yuvraj's back foot is outside off in the stance. Looking for the short leg-side boundary. Slower bouncer from Watson. Beats Yuvraj's attempt to hook. Looks at the leg umpire. This is touch and go on the wide. Not called. It is really really tight
Yuvraj is desperate. Needs to get out of the headlights. He walks down, shuffles across, digs out a yorker. Takes the single. Raina on strike
slower short ball, dragged to long-on for one. Just two off the over so far
yorker outside off. Really quick. At 138ks. Beats the outside edge as Yuvraj looks to drive
moves across, deep into the crease, flicks this from off to leg, gets a couple between deep square and deep midwicket
yorker, and what's more, he has given him the single. Yuvraj on strike first ball next over. Oh this is a cruel sport, T20
Yuvraj finds the touch. Length ball, on the pads, Yuvraj loves it. Is this what lets him off the hook? Flicks it over fine leg. Not the best ball Tye has bowled
Yuvraj is back. He has done it. Gets another length ball on the pads, and he loves it. Goes over the bigger leg-side fence. Beats deep midwicket for a six
Bancroft misses again. Slower offcutter, beats Yuvraj's shot, but Raina steals the bye
yorker, on the pads, placed into the leg side for a couple. India on target. Australia need a dot

full toss on the pads, and for a moment it seems Raina has hit this for four. Flicks this past the diving square leg. Raina starts to celebrate already, but it doesn't go for four. Did they lose a chance to take the third because he began his celebrations prematurely?

Raina can celebrate now. Cool as a cucumber. Yuvraj can sigh in relief. Tye goes short of a length, looks to cramp him up, but Raina makes room to punch this wristily over point for four. Raina punches the air, jumps in the air, Yuvraj lifts him on his shoulder, Raina pats his back. What is Bancroft thinking?
